evidence.title: Ixodidae - Wikipedia
evidence.author: Wikipedia Contributors
evidence.citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2024). Ixodidae. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia.
evidence.note: Ticks in the family Ixodidae possess Haller's organ for olfaction; Amblyomma is in Ixodidae. Inferred from taxonomic relation.

evidence.title: Ixodidae - Wikipedia
evidence.author: Wikipedia Contributors
evidence.citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2024). Ixodidae. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia.
evidence.note: Ticks in the family Ixodidae possess Haller's organ for thermoreception; Amblyomma is in Ixodidae. Inferred from taxonomic relation.

evidence.title: Ixodidae - Wikipedia
evidence.author: Wikipedia Contributors
evidence.citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2024). Ixodidae. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia.
evidence.note: Ticks use setae to sense vibrations; Amblyomma is in Ixodidae. Inferred from taxonomic relation.
